title: (x) Type use in the "Visual Grammar" of Christian Leborg - Akzidenz-Grotesk {Tiff}
content:
What kind of Helvetica or inspiration is this?

This is the type use in the «Visual Grammar» of Christian Leborg.  
I really like the terminals of this «kind of» Helvetica.

Thank you.

author: dji

comments.content:
This is probably Akzidenz Grotesk. It matches closely to what I have as AG Old Face Medium.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130612014502im_/http:/typophile.com/files/agoldfacepreview_5507.png)

\> _What kind of Helvetica or inspiration is this?_

It's the other way around, Jean-François, Helvetica was specifically designed to compete with Akzidenz-Grotesk and is as such inspired by it. (I should know this stuff -- I'm getting interviewed on national radio the day after tomorrow about 50 years of Helvetica and the new Helvetica film ;^).

Where can we listen?
